hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via Regulatory Catalyst Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes with pending regulatory clarity (e.g., MiCA implementation phases, FCA consultations), when BTC breaks above its 20-day Bollinger Band upper bound on >30% above-average volume following positive regulatory news, it will transition to a BULL regime, with breakout momentum continuing for 7+ days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Regulatory clarity removes uncertainty premiums and can trigger institutional inflows. Breakouts from neutral ranges on high volume following such catalysts often mark the beginning of sustained bullish moves as sidelined capital enters.
entry_conditions: Regime == NEUTRAL for at least 10 days
Major positive regulatory development (FCA, MiCA, etc.)
BTC closes above 20-day Bollinger Band upper bound
ETH outperforms BTC on breakout day (ratio increase)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC closes back inside Bollinger Bands

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of such regulatory breakouts fail to sustain momentum and fall back into the prior range within 5 days.
